author: David A. Grogan
title: Jeff Nash: CNBC.com Managing Editor
text:
Jeff Nash: CNBC.com Managing Editor Published 11:32 AM ET Tue, 1 May 2018 Updated 1:23 PM ET Wed, 9 May 2018 CNBC.com Adam Jeffery | CNBC Jeff Nash
Jeff Nash is Managing Editor of Audience Growth for CNBC Digital. In this position, Jeff is responsible for developing and managing CNBC's social, search and partnership teams aimed at continuing the rapid growth of our digital media organization. He also acts as Digital's liaison in the newsroom coordinating the digital and TV teams.
Nash joined CNBC Digital from Dow Jones, where he was Editor of SmartMoney.com and Personal Finance Editor of the Wall Street Digital Network. He reoriented his team's coverage of consumer finance to focus on real-time analysis of the day's most urgent events. Before joining Dow Jones, Nash spent two years as an assistant managing editor at InvestmentNews where he collaborated with the print and online editors to plan and edit news stories and features for both print and digital editions, and was a writer at Money .
Nash holds a Bachelor of Arts in Journalism from Syracuse University. His first byline was at the Syracuse Herald Journal â€“ on the heated competition of two rival doughnut shops. He also has a Master's Degree in Elementary Education from Mercy College and taught elementary school in the Bronx and Japan.
Follow Jeff Nash on Twitter @jeffnash3 and LinkedIn jeffwnash . CNBC Workshops
